course_title: Special Topics: Pol. Reading of Russian Lit.
class_notes: The course focuses on the study of politically charged Russian literature of the 20th century. We will examine Zamiatin's anti-utopia "We" which parodied the Soviet Union and provoked Orwell's review. Students will be acquainted with the fantastic grotesque story of devilish miracles in the Soviet country in Mikhail Bulgakov's story "Dog's Heart" , the ironic narrative discourse of Mikhail Zoshchenko's stories, the absurdism of D. Kharms's prose and poetry, and Andrei Platonov's tragic-parodic prose ("Makar the Doubting," "The State Resident".) All these satirical political discourses serve as a means of investigating social life, its processes, and trends.
course_description: Study of Russian language, literature, or culture, alone or in conjunction with other literary or cultural trends. Topics to be announced in advance. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
